page.title: 17Fire Station, Stirling
page.content: {Stirling Fire Station}on{Raploch Road is 20 years old. The location was chosen because it is the ring road in and out of Stirling and surrounding towns. It is{1 of 4 in Central Region, manned 24 hours every day. 52 men are employed there, plus 10 part-time. 80% of them live in the area. There are{4 {appliances}and a{special support unit for non fire jobs. This is 1 of 4 in the whole Region and covers half of the brigade.{Simon Snorkel's Hydraulic {Platform}can go anywhere in or out of the Region. There is a{helicopter}at the station which is mainly used for moor and woodland fires, which occur mostly in the summer. When not at a fire the men check all{300 items of {equipment.}Appliances are out every day, and checks are made on building's fire exits, extinguishers and the fire warning systems.
